alert.note: Alert for Henry (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 4:53PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Henry County through 530 PM EDT... At 453 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dublin, or near Cambridge City, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Henry County, including the following locations... Straughn and Lewisville. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 125 and 133. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
